Fields.DialogueText: What is all that cheering down there, Nagatsuki? Please, quiet them down - I can't hear myself think.

Fields.MenuText: Fun? We're at war - why aren't you enforcing discipline?
Well, while you're all lollygagging, I'm working. At least keep the noise down.
And I wasn't invited? You'd think the captain of the ship would know about this sort of fun before anyone else here.

Fields.DialogueText: Again, Kanchou... we are sorry for being disruptive. I will let the others know to be more respectful.
In times like these, Kanchou, we must give the crew some form of release. Let them enjoy themselves.
Oh, Kanchou. Why don't you partake? You need some time off, too.
What are they doing down there?
Oh, I was waiting for you to ask. A few of the sailors onboard participated in sumo back home, so we've put together competitions.
Very interesting... and the crew finds this entertaining?
Hai, Kanchou. Oh! The greatest idea has just come to me. What if we put together a sumo tournament event that any sailor can participate in?
I suppose it does sound like a decent way to show camaraderie. I'll allow it, providing you have the time to serve as the planner of the event.
Oh, thank you, Kanchou. The crew will be ecstatic.
I'm sure I don't have to tell you not to let this get in the way of your responsibilities here as a Belle.
Of course not, Kanchou. In fact, I hear battle calling as we speak.
@BATTLE
Gomen'nasai. We were just having a little fun...
Kon'nichiwa, Kanchou. I've missed you.
How can you miss me? We see each other all the time.
Well, it's been some time since I've been able to give you a hug. Come here!

Fields.MenuText: Please don't touch me, Nagatsuki...
I guess that does feel better. Thanks, Nagatsuki...
I don't mind your hugs, Nagatsuki... but you must learn to respect the space of others. Not everyone may be so welcoming.

Fields.DialogueText: Gomen'nasai! I didn't want to make you feel any worse.
Of course, Kanchou! I'm always happy to be of assistance.
Hai, hai, Kanchou. I will be mindful of the feelings of others.
I appreciate having you on board, Nagatsuki.
Well, I'm glad I can be of service. And, speaking of being of service...
I see those ships on the horizon.
What a wonderful time to test out my torpedo tubes... let's go.
@BATTLE
Where are you going? You're here, there... do you ever slow down?
Slow down? Ha! That's for the dying. I've got an urge to go surfing and the waves are looking picturesque. Can't pass this up.
I suppose... be careful out there.
Live a little, Kanchou. Come out and watch if you'd like... or even better, join me.
I might take you up on that offer one day. But right now, I have work to do, so go on.
It's nothing. I'm just not much for hugs.
Oh...
Nagatsuki. I know that I signed off on the tournament, but can you control the noise level? It's actually managing to drown out all the normal ship noises.

Fields.MenuText: That's out of line, Nagatsuki. I can call a stop to this at once, were I to feel it necessary.
A curmudgeon? I've got more life in my pinky than all of you.
That's totally fair. But we do all have work to do, and it's my job to make sure it all gets done.

Fields.DialogueText: Gomen'nasai. I didn't mean it in that way...
If you say so, Kanchou.
Oh, you know that I'm just joking, Kanchou. Don't take my playfulness as a slight.
*ALARM*
Shoot. No more time for conversation, Nagatsuki. Let's go!
@BATTLE
Did you see what my weapons did out there? Oh... I bet everyone's jealous.
They are something, aren't they?
Well, I'm off to ride this wave coming in. Call out if you need anything, Kanchou.
Wait a minute! You have something you need to do.
Nandesuka? What do you mean... I did fleet exercises with my comrades and I polished my armament. That's all I really had on my list for today...
I need you to gather the crew participating in your sumo tournament and remind them to keep it to a dull roar.
Oh... haaaiiiii. I remembered that - sure. I'll be sure to see to it as soon as I return, bye.
WAI... wait. That, Nagatsuki...
Oh, they're just excited, Kanchou. I'll let them know that you're a curmudgeon.
Do you hear that, Kanchou?
Umm... no?
Quiet... liked you asked. I told you that I'd take care of it. Are you proud? I am...
Yes, thank you. I'm actually getting some work done, which... I suppose is better than the alternative. How's your business coming along?
The tournament? Oh, it's wonderful. We are beginning to decide the structure. Oh! I have an idea.
I'm afraid to ask.
Teehee... I think you should introduce the main event.

Fields.MenuText: Absolutely not. This tournament isn't for me and if I'm going to have anything to do with it, it's to sit back and watch it.
I don't know. I'm not much of an attention seeker...
Actually... that's a decent idea, Nagatsuki. I'll give it some thought

Fields.DialogueText: Why don't you think about it? The crew would love for you to do it, I'm sure of it.
Well? Come on, Kanchou... I have to plan things accordingly, and a definite answer is needed sooner than later.
Well, you have plenty of time to decide, Kanchou...
Give me a few days... I won't leave you in the dark. I just need some time to think it over.
That's all I can ask of you, Kanchou. Well, I have to meet with my team of coordinators. We're choosing the music for the event... I already have a song in mind.
Music? There's music at these things? That seems a bit bizarre... I thought it was just a sparring match.
Gomen'nasai. I've got to go before I forget my argument to use this song. We'll pick up where we left off!
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Nagatsuki, look at this here - do you see?
Ahh, it looks like the Funayūrei were going to attempt to ambush us...
Why are you smiling? We must prepare.
This is my specialty, Kanchou. I live for this type of warfare.
Well, then - show me what you've got.
Hai! I was planning on it, Kanchou.
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: You did well out there, Nagatsuki.
I expected more from you... with all of that talk, I wanted to be wowed.
Good, but not great. I can show you a thing or two about that sort of warfare... if you're interested, of course.

Fields.DialogueText: I think I did too!
Everyone could use a little improvement - I am not an exception to that rule.
I don't know what you saw out there, but I think I did great.
Hmm... what do you think I should improve on, since we're on the subject?
Are you sure you want to know what I think... hee...
What's so funny? Yes, I asked, so I  would like to know.
Well, you could loosen up a little... you are too tense. That can't be good for you in the long run.
Tense? I think it's an acceptable flaw during these times, Nagatsuki.
Wakatta - whatever you say, Kanchou. Oh! I must go - a comrade promised me my favorite food. Edomae-zushi. Bye...
Always on the move, that one...
Kanchou, I need your advice... do you mind?
Sure... what is it?
Well, I was talking to the crew about the tournament and I had the best song picked out. But no one agrees...
Huh. It can't be that bad. What song were you thinking?
My most favorite song of all time, of course? "September in the Rain" by Harry Warren and Al Dubin. It's perfect. The melody is a great match with the style of movement in sumo.

Fields.MenuText: I'm sorry to say it, but I agree with the crew. That's a pretty slow song.
Hm. I never would've chosen that song - but I see where you're going with it.
Ooh, I love that song. I think it's a fantastic choice.

Fields.DialogueText: Looks as if I'll need to find some way of convincing you, too.
Wakarimasu ka? I'm happy to hear that, Kanchou!
Yatta! With your support, I'm sure the crew will come around.
It's your event, Nagatsuki. Whatever you do, I am sure it'll turn out wonderfully.
At least someone has faith in my vision of a splendid sumo night.
Don't be like that, Nagatsuki. They have faith... it might just take them some time to understand what you have in mind for the event.
I'll take that as a compliment, Kanchou. Well, I am going to talk to them. Mata ne!
Bye, Nagatsuki. They'll come around.
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Ahhhhh. Don't you love this weather? Koko wa totemo utsukushī...

Fields.MenuText: It's wet... I don't like getting wet.
I do. I enjoy the sound raindrops atop the ship. It's quite tranquil, in my opinion.
Meh, I don't care either way. The only time I care about weather is when it gets in the way of productivity.

Fields.DialogueText: I love the rain. Water is life... we need it.
Plus, the thrill of battling while Mother Nature is smacking down on us? It's really something, Kanchou.
You're always so very concerned with productivity, aren't you, Kanchou?
Nagatsuki... you are peculiar.
Speaking of peculiar, the others gave in to "September in the Rain." They called it odd, but that's fine with me. It's still going to be the introduction song to the final match.
Wait. That's the song for the final match... that I'm going to introduce?
Oh! So, you've decided that you are going to introduce the main event? Great... then we can practice your announcer voice. Ready?
*ALARM*
Are you ready? We have company approaching.
That was good. Nice and deep... next time, enunciate each word like this...
Nagatsuki. FOCUS.
@BATTLE
Maybe you don't need help with enunciation, after all. You really snapped me into attention with FOCUS.
What am I going to do with you, Nagatsuki? Now, off with you. I need some time to decompress.
Hai, hai. But, I'll be back. I always come back.
You seem a little quiet, Nagatsuki... what are you reading?

Fields.MenuText: As in your birthday?
Ha! What can be so special about a number?
Hmm... interesting. I don't think I've ever had a significant number. Or at least, I've never thought about it.

Fields.DialogueText: That's part of it, believe it or not!
Why don't you guess? It seems obvious once you figure it out.
Everyone has a special or lucky number, Kanchou. You just have to be on the lookout for it.
Let's pretend I just spent three straight hours guessing and failing and you're finally taking pity on me.
Oh, such a poor sport. The number is 30 - and I've seen it everywhere today.
Okay. Why 30?
My name was originally Destroyer 30, and I was completed 30 April 1927. Hence, I'm pretty fond of that particular number.
Makes sense to me.
Did you know that my sisters and I were the first to be fitted with these marvelous 24" torpedoes?
I am your captain, you know. I've read the files.
Oh, right. Ha, ha! I... shimatta! I have to go. I'm late for a sumo meeting. We're reviewing the list of participants!
You're excused, Nagatsuki... oh... she's already gone.
I've been seeing a particular number around lately... a pretty special number.
Has anybody seen Nagatsuki? I was hoping to-
*ALARM*
Never mind. She'll be on the bridge.
@BATTLE
Oh, my... oh, my...
What's wrong, Nagatsuki?
Nani mo machigatteinai. NOTHING. I've got it all under control... no worries, Kanchou!

Fields.MenuText: I insist on knowing why you're distressed.
No, we don't take care of issues this way, Nagatsuki. If you're in trouble, we're in trouble.
At least tell me if it has anything to do with our welfare as a whole?

Fields.DialogueText: I can't bear to share my sorrow...
Are you offering me solace, Kanchou?
How can I confide at a moment of such torment?
You can tell me anything, Nagatsuki... does it have anything to do with our security?
Ie... I'm a little annoyed. My comrades and I were doing our weekly fleet exercises... and I didn't win this time.
Okay. Traumatic, but not catastrophically important. I'm sorry, but at least...
What? What do you mean, "not important?"
I'm sorry. That's not what I meant... I just thought it had something to do with, well, the ship as a whole...
You asked me to confide in you and y-you just make fun of me. Oh... I am now tormented with my loss and by my kanchou...
I apologize, Nagatsuki... it wasn't my intention to poke fun at your loss. Take this experience as a lesson and learn from it.
I can't think past the dread I'm feeling.
It isn't good to wallow in these sorts of feelings. Why don't you take some time to yourself to clear your head?
That's a good idea... I'm going to spend time doing something I am great at - surfing under a cloudless sky.
As long as you strive for greater and greater things, Nagatsuki, you will always progress.
Hai. But, Kanchou...
*ALARM*
Hey. I'm sorry about the timing, Nagatsuki. But at least you're great at this too.
@BATTLE
... sometimes striving isn't enough.
You were right, Kanchou. I felt a lot better after surfing and clearing my mind. On top of that, I think I've figured out a way to improve in the areas that caused my loss.

Fields.MenuText: Of course I was right. I can't believe you doubted me.
I'm glad it all worked out, Nagatsuki.
Remember, that's the kind of advice that doesn't expire. It isn't limited to that sole situation.

Fields.DialogueText: Arigatōgozaimashita... your advice meant a lot.
I had to look past your teasing to get to that state of mind, Kanchou... but I got there because of you, and I am thankful for that...
You are a cocky one... but I like it. I didn't know you had that in you.
So, what did you do to improve?
Oh, just things here and there. Also, the sumo tournament event is now official. There are fliers put up all over the ship. The crew is very excited.
Wonderful. That explains the chatter I'm hearing.
*ALARM*
Get ready for battle. Coming in from the east.
Junbi ga dekimashita.
@BATTLE
Wow. I don't have to ask you in detail what you've improved on. You showed me.
Hontōni? I didn't think anyone would notice. It's all thanks to you, Kanchou...
No... that was of your own will.
Thanks. Kanchou... I have to go, I have a handful of things on my to do list, and I am going out for edomae-zushi. I'll bring you back a plate.
Frederic. Have you deciphered the message? What's taking so long?
Captain, we are receiving line after line after line. I am going as fast as I can.
Fair enough. What do we have so far?
Would you like me to read it out loud, Captain?
Yes. Nagatsuki, are you listening?
Hai! Always, Kanchou. I am just working on other things as we wait.
Of course you are. Go ahead, Frederic. Everyone, listen up.
Regards to all that are aboard.
Under the command of General Count Hisaichi Terauchi and Lt. Gen. Masaharu Homma, please prepare to secure the Philippines. Further details will be provided, standby.
All right, then. Frederic, announce this to the crew. We must be ready for action - go now.
Yes, Captain.

Fields.MenuText: It looks like we're headed for some real fun.
I'm not sure whether I should be excited or frightened for our lives.
Leisure may have to come to a halt...

Fields.DialogueText: I live for this sort of thing - if I'm not stirred, what's the point of living?
Oh, my... what will happen to our sumo event?
Blah... I guess this means more work and less play?
Consider this an order to keep your spirits up, Nagatsuki... we may be heading into darker stages. The crew's going to be looking to you for inspiration.
Hai! So, what are we going to do about our sumo tournament?
One thing at a time. Look over there.
@BATTLE
Captain, we are currently receiving intel on the mission. Please, stand by as I decipher the code.
Finally...
Hai. Finally. Kanchou, I think we should move the tournament up... it's overwhelming waiting on our next move.
Not now, Nagatsuki. We still have more to hear from Frederic.
Hai, hai...  I was just saying.
Okay...
Your patience is greatly appreciated.
You are advised to prepare and organize as we continue to gather details. Departure has been scheduled and day and time will be provided soon.
I'm afraid your tournament is now officially on the back burner, Nagatsuki.
Chotto matte kudasai! There has to be another way. I-I-I can change the time and day.

Fields.MenuText: I don't see how that's going to change anything, Nagatsuki.
Hmm... could you make that work?
That doesn't sound like a good idea. We have to keep our minds on task. An event could prove distracting.

Fields.DialogueText: Please, Kanchou. Everyone was already looking forward to it.
I have such confidence in our crew. They're up to any challenge.
How like you to take away fun from us all... rather selfish, don't you think?
Okay. Proceed with the preparations until and unless orders from Command get in the way - but I will not tolerate any faltering in performance of our actual duties.
I don't know why you're being so harsh. We are always ready to go after a good night's party.
What?
*ALARM*
Oh... looks like it's time to go!
@BATTLE
All right, I changed the date of the event to a closer date. There was some fuss, but the reasons are understood.
Okay. At the moment, things are up in the air, so who knows when we're headed off.
That's understood by all. The war is everywhere... but that doesn't mean we can't enjoy ourselves every now and then.

Fields.MenuText: I never said otherwise, Nagatsuki.
If you're reminding me that I'm a curmudgeon...
She says accusingly...

Fields.DialogueText: It's what everyone thinks, Kanchou.
I don't mean it in that way. I just wish you'd let yourself live. Even you need time to exhale.
I'm not accusing you of anything! And it doesn't make sense for us to go back and forth. A waste of time... I could be surfing.
All that matters is that you took care of the date. Truce?
Hai. Truce. We need to stick together.
*ALARM*
Like right now. Ha!
Ready?
@BATTLE
We've got this, Kanchou. We may enjoy our luxuries, but we also know when it's time to put the sword in the flame.
Listen - I didn't want you and the crew running yourselves ragged as the schedule tightens up. But I never thought you couldn't pull it off. I'm sorry if it seemed like I did.
We never thought otherwise, Kanchou. We trust your judgment.
Thank you, Nagatsuki.
Dōitashimashite. My pleasure, Kanchou. Well... I must, um, fix my... hair. Bye.
Nagatsuki. What is that racket? We have company.
Gomen'nasai, Kanchou. Yatte mimashou.
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: Good grief, Nagatsuki... I almost missed those Morganas coming in.
I'm starting to think I should be selling balls of cotton to put in people's ears. I could make a killing off of anyone who wants to sleep.
I guess that'll help us get ready for this upcoming hoopla... noise and surprises.

Fields.DialogueText: It wasn't that bad. It's just a little chaotic, what with the event and our big trip to the Philippines all coming up. There's going to be some noise, Kanchou.
Hai, hai. We're a little loud. But there is so much going on, give us a break, Kanchou.
Gomen'nasai. We'll do our best to rein ourselves in. It's just... there's a lot going on right now.
Still, you did well during that battle, Nagatsuki. Thank you.
Dōitashimashite. Would you like to have some edomae-zushi with me? I think you need some time to relax.
I guess I have been a bit stressed. I apologize, Nagatsuki. You know what...? Sure.
Wonderful. First we'll surf. Then we'll eat.
Wait a minute, I agreed to food, not surfing.
Hai, hai. But you might as well come out and surf, too. Live a little, would you?
Live a little? I am breathing and my heart still knocks against my chest... I'm considered alive.
You know what I mean. Come on, it'll be quick. I'll show you some tricks.
I don't know why I'm doing this, but... all right. Quick, before I change my mind.
Yatte mimashou.
Good work, everyone! But don't even think of relaxing until the last fires are out.
*whew*
It's okay, Kanchou - they're already out. It's just basic clean-up now. I think you're finally free to go off-duty if you want.
Sorry about all the noise before.
It's all coming together. The show will go on, we're ready to take over some waters... and we're ahead of schedule, Kanchou.
You're right. ... Thanks for trying to keep me levelheaded. It's nice, knowing I can depend on you, Nagatsuki. We've gotten closer, haven't we?
Close? Hmm... you mean, like close? Ha! You should see your face. I'm just kidding, Kanchou.

Fields.MenuText: I didn't mean it like that... that's not something you should hint at, Nagatsuki. People might get the wrong impression.
I was kidding too!
Deflecting through humor, Nagatsuki?

Fields.DialogueText: I don't understand what you're saying, Kanchou.
Sō sō. Sure you were. Suuuuuure.
What's that supposed to mean?
It never takes much for rumors to spread.
You think too much, Kanchou. How often do you leave your office and the bridge? Step out and get some air from time to time...
A little fresh air from time to time probably would do me some good. Everything is calm outside, now. Although, there's a storm coming in from the west.
Storms are when the best things happen - violence, destruction, and beauty merged into one.
That's one way to look at it, I suppose. You are intriguing, Nagatsuki... has anyone ever told you that?
Hai! All the time, Kanchou. Not that exact word, but similar... odd, peculiar, strange. But I make everyone smile, so I don't mind.
That you do.
What's the point in enjoying life and keeping that joy to myself? I have more than enough to share. Time is my enemy. I must make use of my life while I have it.
That is a good way of thinking.
... But now to more vulgar concerns.
@BATTLE
Yeah. I see them.
Hi, Nagatsuki. You look a bit worn out. Busy day, I take it?
Just a bit busy. But I do appreciate this beautiful weather.
It is nice outside... and things seem to have quieted down. How is the crew doing? Keeping up with the upcoming changes?
Hai. They're doing well. They're an admirable bunch.
That's good to hear. So when is this event? Should I practice my, *ahem*, announcer voice?
Ha, ha... either you've been practicing or you're a natural. The event is coming up soon.

Fields.MenuText: Of course I've been practicing. It's been my meditation lately... looking in the mirror and saying, with my best voice, “For ROUND five, I am pleased to announce..."
Nope, no practice. If you think about it, captains are born to bellow out in front of a crowd and command attention.
You flatter me, Nagatsuki... if you think I sound great, then that's all I need to know.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm serious, you sound great. Perhaps you could be an announcer after the war.
You sound good, but maybe don't quit your day job yet.
I don't give out compliments I don't mean, Kanchou. You sound great.
Well, I'm glad that I'm ready.
You were born ready, Kanchou. You may be a worrywart, but you deliver nonetheless.
Worrywart? I'm just not a nut like you. Which I say affectionately, Nagatsuki.
I've been called far worse.
You live the life of someone reaching for the stars, and that's admirable.
As do you, Kanchou. You just reach differently than I do.
Okay, that's enough banter. If we go on too long, we might reveal things about ourselves that could be used as fodder.
How do you know that you haven't already said too much? Ha!
*ALARM*
Ha... I may already have...
@BATTLE
Nagatsuki? What is this mess? You have things strewn about here and there...
Oh, I'll clean it up, Kanchou. Those are just things for the sumo event.
I'll be happy when the event is over... it's been more time-consuming... and messy... than I originally anticipated.
Oh, you're excited, admit it.

Fields.MenuText: Not at all. It's been a hindrance since the day I said yes.
Okay, maybe a little... but still, Nagatsuki. You have to keep organized.
I am excited, actually. But it doesn't give you the right to make a mess.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm trying to create the best event that I can, and you're just... such a stick in the mud.
How lucky of me to not be disturbed by your curmudgeonous attitude.
You make me smile even when you're unreasonable. Anata wa kawai sugiru!
I don't know what it is about you, Nagatsuki... but you always get me laughing.
*ALARM*
I'm glad you laugh at my expense, Kanchou... but look here. We've got a party to attend.
A party? Is that what you think about fighting? Ha, ha...
@BATTLE
That was fun! Well, I better get back to all this and set up for the best sumo tournament anyone here will ever attend.
All right, Nagatsuki. I'll be over here working amongst the chaos of your creation...
KANCHOU. You must get ready... why haven't you changed?
I know, I know. My clothes are hanging over there. I'm just getting a few things done before this event of yours.
It's an event for all of us, Kanchou.
*ALARM*
We have enemies coming in... of course... trying to rain on my parade.
I suppose it's a good thing I hadn't changed yet. Let's do this, so that we can get your show on the road.
Junbi dekimashita!
@BATTLE
All right, get out of here, Nagatsuki. You still have setting up to do, and I have to get ready.
Hai. I'll see you there, Kanchou. Dress sharp, you're going to have to stand in front of the whole crew.
I'll be there, don't worry about it.
I know you will. Frederic is going to be sure of it.

Fields.MenuText: Seriously, Nagatsuki? I'm not a child.
Fine, but he might as well make himself useful and clean up some of this mess you've left behind.
No. I don't need any help, Nagatsuki.

Fields.DialogueText: Don't care. I can't have anything go wrong with this event, and you aren't an exception.
I already have him taking care of that for me, thank you very much.
Please, Kanchou. This has to go perfectly.
All right, all right. It's too late for me to protest. Get out of here. I'll be there.
She left already, Captain.
Of course she did. Help me get this place organized before we leave, would you, Frederic?
Yes, Captain.
That was really fun, Nagatsuki. It definitely gave me a chance to relax... and it looks like everyone else had a great time as well.
It was fun, wasn't it? You did really well, announcing the final match.
Anata wa sō omoimasu ka? Ha... I was a bit nervous up there, to be honest.
What? I couldn't even tell... you hid it well.
Heh, I'm glad you couldn't tell. That means I did my job well.
Ha, ha... no, I couldn't tell.
What is that, Frederic? Sounds like a long transmission...
We're receiving more intel on our next mission, Captain.
I see... and it looks like we have enemies approaching. Ready, Nagatsuki?
Hai! Ready!
@BATTLE
Okay, back to what we were doing... Frederic, do you have that dispatch ready to read? Go on, then.
"Depart your current coordinates towards the Philippines Islands immediately. Fend off Morgana threat east of Davao City."

Fields.MenuText: It's showtime. All right, let's inform the rest of the crew.
Hopefully all of our preparations will pay off.
Time to walk straight into the depths of hell and hope we come out unscathed.

Fields.DialogueText: Someone sounds excited.
I'm sure they will, Kanchou.
Feeling a little dramatic, Kanchou?
Make the announcement, Frederic. And Nagatsuki... Nagatsuki?
I think she left to do the announcing. I'll follow her to be sure, Captain.
Very well. You're excused, Frederic. At least she's excited. You'd think the event would've slowed her down...
What a life...

Fields.MenuText: What do I look like, Nagatsuki? Your assistant?
Make a note to yourself... no one should have to do that for you, Nagatsuki.
Sure. I can't believe you've found time for leisure activities, even out here...

Fields.DialogueText: Well, you seem like someone who likes keeps track of things... a little reminder for a friend isn't asking too much, in my opinion.
Oh, Kanchou. I only ask you because you're so very responsible. I trust you...
Oh, I can make time for leisure activities anywhere, Kanchou.
Whatever. Here... take this note and put it in your pocket. That should be enough to remind you.
Sorya subarashī. But what if I forget about it being there? Ha! I guess we'll have to wait and see.
*ALARM*
I suppose so. Get ready, crew. Incoming vessels.
@BATTLE
Ha... that was way too easy. When are we going to have a real challenge? Boooring.
Be careful what you wish for, Nagatsuki. We're all in this together. You should be glad that we've been able to handle our opponents so far.
And I'm sure we'll handle the rest of them with aplomb. We're only adding to our experiences fighting the Funayūrei.
I have no doubt, but never look down at your enemies. We must continue to look at them as worthy adversaries.
You may put a damper on things, but your wiseness is apparent. I will note that... mentally.
Ha! I am the captain of this ship for a reason, Nagatsuki. I'll try to be less boring... but I make no promises.
If you were less boring, I'd wonder if the spirits had taken over you.
Yeah, yeah... I'm sure.
Hey, Kanchou... just got back from surfing these waves out here - remind me to check these waters off my list.
We're receiving intel, Kanchou. Frederic is deciphering it as we speak.
Very well. The timing is wonderful... I feel as though I had a premonition of an incoming message.
Hontōni? Hmm... intuition or a granted wish?
Ha! Not at all. I just figured we'd get a message since I was stepping away from the bridge.
Ahh... I guess sometimes things work in wondrous ways.

Fields.MenuText: It's annoying to say the least. I'd like a breather every now and then.
Wondrous... that's a way to describe it. Not the word I would've chosen, but it works.
Wondrous? Right.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm sure we'll get one before you know it, Kanchou!
You're welcome for the help.
Blah, blah, blah. Such a curmudgeon, Kanchou.
Humph. Hi, Frederic - Nagatsuki informed me of the telegraph. I see that you've deciphered the message. Please, go on and read.
Yes, Captain.
We've been assigned to an escort operation in and around Malaysia. We are to prepare for departure.
Very well.
It looks as if more surfing opportunities are on the horizon, Nagatsuki.
It does. I'll make the announcement.
Thank you, Nagatsuki. Also, make checks on the ship's current status.
I've already done that, Kanchou. We're always ready! Mata ne!
Hmm... she may love having fun, but she stays on top of her duties.
@BATTLE
Kon'nichiwa! What are you writing? An appreciation letter to me? HA!
Oh, hi, Nagatsuki... just jotting some of my thoughts down.
About? I'm just kidding, you don't have to tell me. I'll just read it another time.

Fields.MenuText: No. Just... no.
Please tell me you're not saying you read my journal.
What am I going to do with you, Nagatsuki?

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, come on. The more I understand what's going on in your head, the better it'll be for us all.
Don't worry, I won't tell anyone about how you really feel.
You're not mad at me, are you? I do it for our success as a whole.
Well, now I know not to write anything incriminating.
Don't be that way, Kanchou. If it makes you feel better, you write really well and your penmanship is rather legible.
It doesn't... but thank you for the compliments. You do some things that irk me, but generally, your merits make up for such faults.
I'll take that as a compliment, half-hearted though it may be.
All right, now. Get out of here. I need to finish my writings and... get this place cleaned up.
Hai, hai... don't spend too much time writing about me. Ha! Mata ne!
*ALARM*
... From another planet, that Nagatsuki.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
The alarms are going off...
Hai. It looks like we have maintenance working on it right now.
Isn't that wonderful... is it under control?
Yes, the alarms should go off... now.
They're still running!
And no wonder... looks as if we have friends coming for a visit from the east.
Do these things ever rest?
@BATTLE
Well, at least they didn't overstay their welcome.
Heh. Our crew has improved tremendously... your fleet exercises must be paying off.
Hai, hai... but I think they're also naturally talented. Their pride in the ship, in you... that's what you're really seeing.

Fields.MenuText: Hmm... thank you, Nagatsuki. That's kind of you to say.
Don't flatter me. Flattery is a form of manipulation.
Ahh, so they see me as motivation? I wonder what else I can get them to do.

Fields.DialogueText: Don't inflate your head just yet, Kanchou. There's still room to improve.
The crew is only as good as their leaders. For them to succeed, we must provide them the foundation to do their job well.
Hai. They respect you, Kanchou. Keep it that way.
Am I rubbing off on you? Getting serious, don't you think?
Now, I'm blushing. Perhaps you are getting to me. You have good advice to give from time to time.
I try, Nagatsuki. I can only try.
And that you do, Kanchou. Arigatōgozaimashita - from us all.
Do you think we'll make it out of this? I mean... there's a possibility that we won't, right?
Where did this come from? Is something wrong?
Nothing is wrong... I just got to thinking and what if... you know?

Fields.MenuText: Don't talk like that, Nagatsuki. It's bad luck.
Well, it's okay to think of these things. But use your insight to make it into something positive.
You're worrying me, Nagatsuki. Have you eaten yet? Maybe you're just hungry...

Fields.DialogueText: Hai, hai. I guess it's something that shouldn't be thought of...
I know the thoughts are darker than my typical topics of conversation... but I can think about these things too.
I'm not crazy, right? In order to understand things, we must entertain all possibilities.
You can talk to me about these things. I just don't want the crew to catch wind and think that our demise is upon us.
Wakarimasu. I would never place my anxieties on the crew. Thank you for letting me do so with you.
That's one of my duties as captain, Nagatsuki. I will always be here for you... and everyone else.
It looks like you're going to have to be here for us right now. Funayūrei approaching...
@BATTLE
Well, you seem to be in a better mood, now.
I love seeing us all work together in unison. I'm very proud of our crew - of us...
Me, too. Just in case there was any doubt.
What is this? Frederic, do you know who put this here?
I did. That's for you, Kanchou. From us all. A thank you for being a wonderful leader.
Oh... should I open it now?
Hai! Don't just stare at it, Kanchou... it's to be relished.
Okay, okay. Oh... fountain pen?
Do you like it? There's ink there, and a journal, too.

Fields.MenuText: I love it. I needed a new pen and my journal is in its last pages. I'll have to write a thank you letter to everyone with it.
Well, I didn't need one, but I'll put it to use.
I like it. It's different. I've never been given a pen as a gift before.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm sure you'll use it, so I'm not worried about that.
If you don't like it, we can give you something else.
Are you sure you really like it?
I can use it, I can use it. No need to get worked up. I really appreciate the thought, Nagatsuki.
Okay. We just thought, you know, since we see you writing all the time, that it would be something you might enjoy.
I love it, Nagatsuki. Thank you.
Dōitashimashite. I'll leave you be, then... that way you can make time to write that thank you note. Mata ne!
Oh... I didn't mean now... and now I'm talking to myself.
I'm still here, Captain. She put a lot of time into choosing that gift for you.
I assumed so... she puts a lot of thought into what she does. Thank you to you too, Frederic.
Yes, Captain. I will be leaving now.
You are excused.

Fields.MenuText: I can see us being a dynamic duo.
She's really is beautiful, and she balances me out so...
